decks.notes: This combo deck focuses on assembling the Aluren combo, which allows you to cast creatures with converted mana cost 3 or less for free, enabling powerful synergies and potential game-ending plays. The deck includes various creatures with powerful abilities that synergize well with Aluren, along with efficient interaction spells to protect the combo. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in the deck. With a consistent mana base and access to card selection and manipulation, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck utilizes the Food Chain combo to generate infinite mana by exiling creatures and casting them repeatedly. The key strategy involves using cards like Misthollow Griffin and Squee, the Immortal to generate the necessary mana for big plays like Hydroid Krasis or Walking Ballista. The deck also includes cards like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for value and card advantage. The use of manipulation spells like Manipulate Fate and cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm helps to find key combo pieces and maintain consistency throughout the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with a combination of taxing effects and aggressive creatures while also utilizing powerful equipment to close out games quickly. By applying pressure early with creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck aims to slow down opponents and control the battlefield with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and gain tempo advantage. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting opponents' game plan while building up a board presence to overwhelm them.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, backed up by disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, while also utilizing counter magic like Force of Negation. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive spells like Stifle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's aggressive strategy with fetch lands and dual lands.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill your entire library, bringing Narcomoebas onto the battlefield and using Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for a game-winning win condition. The deck includes various manipulation and protection spells such as Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Daze to control the game, with Living Wish serving as a toolbox card to find necessary pieces. Aether Vial provides additional creature deployment flexibility while Stoneforge Mystic can fetch utility equipments like Batterskull.

This deck focuses on playing efficient threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter magic and land destruction. The key strategy is to deploy threats like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis early, while using cards like Daze and Force of Will to protect them. Lightning Bolt provides additional reach to finish off opponents, while cards like Stifle can disrupt key abilities. The deck's mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells while also utilizing Mystic Sanctuary for additional value.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana with creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Heritage Druid, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to bring out powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. Glimpse of Nature helps draw into more creatures, while Wirewood Symbiote provides creature protection. Allosaurus Shepherd protects against counterspells, and Archon of Valor's Reach can lock out certain strategies. The deck includes some disruption with Collector Ouphe and versatile searching with Once Upon a Time. Gaea's Cradle is a key land for generating mana.

This Legacy Maverick deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary to disrupt opponents while applying pressure. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Gaddock Teeg and Plague Engineer to control the opponent's resources. Utilizing the Green Sun's Zenith package, the deck can search for important creatures in different situations. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also providing utility lands like Karakas and Gaea's Cradle. The deck aims to outmaneuver opponents through efficient threats and disruptive elements.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total in order to play powerful Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler creatures. The deck also focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, Stifle, and Force of Will. The deck's mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. The goal is to apply pressure with aggressive creatures while controlling the game with disruptive spells, ultimately winning the game through a combination of creature damage and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible using cards like Vampire Hexmage, Elvish Reclaimer, and Crop Rotation. This combo involves creating a 20/20 Marit Lage token by sacrificing Dark Depths with no ice counters on it. The deck also includes disruption elements like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's resources while the combo is being assembled. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and provide flexibility through cards like Mox Diamond and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth.

The deck focuses on cheating big, game-winning creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play quickly through cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. It also aims to protect its combo pieces with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck employs card selection and manipulation with spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Impulse to help find key combo pieces. It also utilizes Cunning Wish for additional versatility and options. The mana base is built around fast mana sources like Lotus Petal, Ancient Tomb, and City of Traitors to power out big plays early.

The main theme of this deck is to control the pace of the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on generating card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Baleful Strix, while also being able to handle various threats with cards like Plague Engineer and Assassin's Trophy. The diverse mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, while cards like Mystic Sanctuary and Court of Cunning provide additional options for recursion and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan using a combination of aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stifle. The deck aims to control the board with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will, while also having access to flexible threats such as Hexdrinker and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy while also utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, the Great Creator to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a heavy emphasis on mana denial through cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Trinisphere, the deck aims to slow down the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence with cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats while shutting down their ability to effectively cast spells.

The deck focuses on locking down the opponent's mana base by using cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Blood Sun, preventing them from casting spells efficiently. It also uses powerful threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, the Great Creator to close out the game quickly. The deck utilizes fast mana acceleration with Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to cast its powerful threats ahead of curve. Additionally, cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void help to control the board and protect against aggressive strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence using powerful red creatures like Fireflux Squad, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Hanweir Garrison. By also utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Blood Moon, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slow them down. The inclusion of cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide help to accelerate the deck's game plan, while cards like Magus of the Moon and Shatterskull Smashing provide additional disruption and removal options. The deck heavily relies on a mana denial strategy using cards like Ancient Tomb, City of Traitors, and Mountains.
